greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = sum of the k-th parts of all partitions of n with their parts written in nondecreasing order.
comment: In row n, the sum of all odd-indexed terms minus the sum of all even-indexed terms is equal to A194714(n).
Reversed rows converge to A014153. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 13 2012
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..70, flattened
example: Row 4 is 9, 7, 3, 1 because the five partitions of 4, with their parts written in nondecreasing order, are
And the sums of the columns are 9, 7, 3, 1.
xref: Column 1 is A046746. Row sums give A066186.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 13 2012
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 13 2012
